decks.notes: This deck aims to control the game by utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells such as Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Kolaghan's Command to handle threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency in casting spells, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands. The overall strategy is to outvalue the opponent and disrupt their game plan while maintaining card advantage.

This Legacy Dark Depths combo deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a powerful 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck includes various ways to tutor for the combo pieces, protect them from disruption, and disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. It also includes some utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Ghost Quarter to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to win the game quickly and efficiently through the combo while controlling the opponent's resources.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo, using cards like Vampire Hexmage and Thespian's Stage to generate a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes various ways to search for and protect the combo pieces, such as Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Pithing Needle. Thoughtseize and Duress help disrupt opponents' strategies while Elvish Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal provide fast mana acceleration. The inclusion of cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Ghost Quarter allows for defense against opposing threats and strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base using hate cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while also controlling the board with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Hazoret the Fervent. This deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and deal damage to the opponent efficiently with burn spells like Fiery Confluence. By locking down the opponent's resources and applying pressure with aggressive threats, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. It utilises cards like Eldrazi Mimic, Thought-Knot Seer, and Reality Smasher to apply pressure early on, supported by disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail to control the opponent's resources. The mana base of Ancient Tomb, Eldrazi Temple, and Cavern of Souls allows for efficient ramping, while land disruption with Wasteland and utility lands like Karakas provide additional advantages. Overall, the deck aims to win through fast, strong creature combat.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana through creatures such as Deathrite Shaman, Nettle Sentinel, and Heritage Druid, combined with Gaea's Cradle and other mana-producing lands. By utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order, the deck aims to quickly find and play powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth for a game-winning attack. Support cards like Quirion Ranger and Wirewood Symbiote help enable this strategy while also providing card advantage through Elvish Visionary and Nissa, Vital Force. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and powerful Elf combo.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game with cheap and versatile spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Lightning Bolt, while utilizing the graveyard with Deathrite Shaman and Gurmag Angler. The mana base is designed to support a diverse range of spells and maximize the deck's strategy.

The deck revolves around using lands to control the game by utilizing card advantage and resource denial. It aims to assemble the Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage combo for a powerful finish while disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter. Life from the Loam provides constant card advantage and graveyard recursion, while cards like Punishing Fire and Engineered Explosives offer removal options. The deck is designed to outlast the opponent and grind out wins through attrition and resource management.

This deck focuses on disruption and removal while utilizing efficient creatures to pressure the opponent. The main objective is to control the game through cards like Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, and Liliana of the Veil, while generating card advantage with Baleful Strix and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. True-Name Nemesis serves as an evasive threat that can quickly close out games, supported by cards like Umezawa's Jitte and equipment. The mana base is designed to support a variety of spells, with Wasteland providing additional disruption against opposing lands.

The main idea of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence using efficient Merfolk creatures such as Master of the Pearl Trident and Silvergill Adept, supported by disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of tempo plays, card advantage from cards like True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique, and protection from counterspells. Cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls help to ensure that the deck can consistently deploy threats while holding up disruption for the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through powerful spells like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Terminus while generating card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Search for Azcanta. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with countermagic like Force of Will and Counterbalance, and also has removal options with cards like Swords to Plowshares. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency in casting spells while utilizing cards like Back to Basics to disrupt opponents' mana bases. The goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by managing the opponent's threats through card advantage, removal, and counterspells. The deck aims to maintain control of the board using cards like Terminus, Swords to Plowshares, and Council's Judgment while also manipulating draws with cards like Brainstorm and Predict. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for long-term advantage and win conditions like Entreat the Angels. Search for Azcanta helps to filter the deck and find key cards while Force of Will and Counterbalance help to protect the game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage and tempo manipulation, utilizing powerful Planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Monastery Mentor. With a suite of draw spells like Ponder, Portent, and Predict, the deck aims to set up powerful plays while consistently hitting land drops for mana efficiency. Removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus deal with threats efficiently, while counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell protect the game plan. The deck can adapt to various situations with cards like Council's Judgment and Back to Basics, ensuring a strong control over the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to outlast the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also utilizes cards like Terminus and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats on the board, while cards like Monastery Mentor provide a win condition. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and includes utility lands like Back to Basics to further disrupt the opponent's resources.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana-producing artifacts, then using card draw and selection spells to find key combo pieces. Once enough mana is generated, the player can cast spells like Ad Nauseam or Infernal Tutor to win the game with a large storm count, casting Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens for massive amounts of damage. The deck also includes disruption in the form of discard spells like Cabal Therapy and Duress to protect the combo.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly put powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Reanimate and Exhume, in addition to utilizing cards like Entomb and Careful Study to fill the graveyard. Show and Tell can also be used to cheat creatures into play while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats like Griselbrand and Elesh Norn, while also having options for protection and disruption.
